author: Gina Daidone
title: Runaway cow makes dash for freedom in Queens | New York Post
text:
Breaking ‚Äòmoos‚Äô!
YO‚Ä¶I'm usually not a witness to this stuff but I'm on my way into the office and a f*cking cow that has gotten loose comes down the street and walks right pass meüêÑüòÇ #GOTMILK#southside#cow#imawitness#letthisonelive#freeatlast#nyc#queens#globalwarming 
A post shared by Vladimirüêé (@saint_xxi) on Feb 21, 2017 at 8:08am PST 
A runaway cow is on the loose in Queens ‚Äî hoofing it across sidewalks and into one neighbor‚Äôs backyard Tuesday morning, according cops and witnesses.
The farmyard troublemaker took off to explore the urban jungle at around 10 a.m. in Jamaica and and was last seen trotting down Archer Avenue and 146th Street, officials said.
It‚Äôs not clear where the cow came from or how it got loose but the neighborhood is known for its slaughterhouses and history of escaped livestock.
Stunned neighbors shot a video of the brave bovine running ‚Äî tongue out ‚Äî down a quiet residential street,
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs the cow!‚Äù one resident shouted after catching a glimpse of the wild sight.
The roving cow was still on the loose as of 11:30 a.m. Police were still trying to wrangle it.
